alert.note: Alert for Erie (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 3:05AM EDT until August 25 at 3:04AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Vermilion River Near Vermilion affecting Erie and Lorain Counties. For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Vermilion River...including Vermilion...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Huron River Near Milan. * WHEN...From this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Flood waters over a foot deep in Franklin Flats. Huron River Valley Campground inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 19.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.4 feet on 01/30/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM EDT.
